author: A_Brickset_user
title: Great small castle!
review: One of my earliest lego sets was also tons of fun! The castle can be turned to show off its impressive wingspan, or to close up for easier defense. The alternate model is a really neat medieval style dungeon. The minifigs were a good value (3 Dragonmen and 2 Black Falcons, including a knight) and the catapult was a big plus, so was the dungeon door. Could be combined with other castle sets or plain black basic legos to make a very respectable medium sized castle. Plenty of weapons as well. Tons of fun.

author: A_Brickset_user
title: Another great castle set. *Salutes lego*
review:
I have two of these (They fit together awesomely as a good Castle) but their also good stand-alone. As with the Sea Serpent, a lot of figs and weapons, and that catapult is pwnage!

Pros:
Lots of figs
Lots of weapons
Cool catapult
Cool fortress

Cons:
For the unimaginative at least the walls not going around can be annoying. But I have to say I've gotten around that.

author: StormSworder
title: Nice castle wall, rubbish catapult.
review: This is another of those 'castle under attack' sets.  The castle wall is great, comes with gates, a prison cell, battlements and plenty of soldiers and weapons.  The sections of wall either side of the gate are hinged and so can be posed in various positions.  The attacking forces unfortunately, are what let down the set as a whole.  The previous 'castle under attack' sets boasted a siege tower and a battering ram.  In this set is a catapult.  This would be fine, but the strange design means the 'arm' has only limited movement and so does not physically work.  You can always pretend, I suppose, but the 6030 catapult could really fling lego bricks.  Still, well worth tracking down just for the great-looking castle wall.

author: legotrainfan
title: Under attack
review:
This is a great little castle that is attacked by two Falcons with their catapult. The walls are nothing special, but so what?! You get a prison, which normally only comes with bigger castles, and several minifigs with a lot of weapons. But there could have been more shields The Falcon soldier and the men who defend the castle have none. Apart from that, the catapult does not work so well. The big weight, which goes downwards when throwing bricks towards the castle's walls, often falls off. This is annoying! Catapult 6030 works much better. 

What I especially like are the big brown gates. They are big enough for carriages to pass through. And another good thing about it is that you can connect it with other castles. I often connected it with castle 6085. Or I just moved the two walls of it backwards - hinges make that possible - and put it in front of the drawbridge of set 6085. Then enemies must first defeat the knights of the little castle before entering the big one after it.

author: Huge_Nerd
title: very fun set!
review:
This is a really great set.

The fort has a nice jail and a big gate. It is also flexible so it can be used in a variety of ways: as a stand-alone fort, an additional section of another castle, a gate to a narrow pass, etc. I like the red guys' chest pieces and black helmets.

The knight and catapult give this set some great play value--the catapult works great!

author: AETerry
title: Poor Man's Black Monarch's Castle
review:
That's how I always felt with this set... I missed out on getting the Black Monarch's Castle when it first came out and in a way made do with this this.

 

It's not bad... it gave me a fort of sorts for any "loose" Dragon Knights who lacked a headquarters and two Black Falcon minifigures. The knight on horse back has (new at the time) plate armor accessory and helmet with visor, so that made getting this set another plus, having more of the new style knights with the new armor. There's an okay catapult build for assaulting the fort.

 

I'm glad I've got it, I think I'd still have picked up if I was doing a "do over" on which sets I was buying or not.

author: knightofgold
title: An interesting flawed set
review:
I picked this set up at Walmart on sale for a whopping $15 in 1992. That was a lot of saved up allowance money for me back then. I already had the Black Monarch's Castle and Black Falcon's Fortress, so this was a very nice supplement. I had a lot of fun as a kid besieging and destroying this gate. It  was always the first line of defence.

The stronghold looks really neat with the large imposing gates, but it is really very fragile. I always found it really easy to knock over and come apart. It also had the connectors on the end to attach it to other sets. Unfortunately it doesn't quite fit onto the Black Monarch's Castle unless you have it completely opened up to look like one long wall. I always thought it looked weird that way with the stronghold sticking out on the end.

The set has a nice number of minifigures, even if the all red guys look a little odd. And I think this was the only Black Falcon knight who came with the cool armour and helmet. I wish the second Black Falcon mini had the emblem on his chest, or a second shield. It also came with crossbows which were still really new.

Back in the day this was a good value for the dollar set, especially on sale. Probably not so much anymore. The Black Falcon knight in his armour is the most unique mini in the set, the rest of the minis not so much. This is that weird period in the early 90s when lego was slowly killing the Black Falcons off and I guess they didn't want to make any more of them with the torso print.

author: SirSven7
title: Lego Steve's review
review:
This set shows the final resistance of the Black Falcon’s, I almost want them to conquer the stronghold so that they have somewhere to stay (as in 1990 they had no more sets of their own for the last few years).

 This set is all good, the catapult is interesting, the castle to well built, hinged and contains a jail, the numbers of figures are good and we even get a horse. It was designed to be attached to Black Monarchs Castle, which gives this set even more strength, my only criticisms for the set are the lack of quiver (again) for the crossbow and the ‘all red’ look on the Black Knights is very unappealing.

It is a great ‘all in one’ play set, with everything you need to start loving Lego castle.

If you like this review click on the link to find it and all reviews of the Castle sets
